data.title: When it is described as "Italian, Mediterrarian, Vegan", the emphasis is "Vegan"!
data.text: This is a cool, hard to find restaurant, downtown Wichita.  It's in the courtyard of an old building, very high ceilings.  Service was terrific as well as the food.  Three of us went, and each enjoyed thier meal.  What we didn't realize when we decided to go there was that it was totally vegan, (I think, at least vegetarian).  It had a great menu, salads, sandwiches, pizza's, pasta, soups, etc.  I recommend, even if you aren't vegetarian.

data.title: Amazing!!!!! 10 Stars!!
data.text: Loved the BBQ sandwich!  The sauce and bread was to die for!!!  Pizza is the best you've ever had and the salads have a unique taste that gives salad a good name!!

data.title: wonderful discovery in Wichita, KS
data.text: The atmosphere is charming, the staff is professional and friendly.  The Menu offers many selections and the focus is on healthy food.  A good experience.

data.title: A must try even for non-vegetarians!
data.text: My mother and I are not vegetarian, but we love trying new places. We went for Sunday brunch and it was fantastic! The staff is very friendly and the food was delicious and very filling. It was very inexpensive compared to other restaurants that offer Sunday brunch. We will definitely go back.

data.title: Hidden Gem
data.text:
I love this place and you will.  It is hands-down one of my favorite reasons to go to Wichita.  Every time I am in Wichita I hustle to see if my schedule will allow a meal at the Garden Grill Café.  It is a wonderful little vegan restaurant but you would not know it from the taste of the delicious food.
The Garden Grill is a little hard to find as the entrance is tucked around the back off the parking lot at 300 N Main but once you have had Chef's food, you will want to go back.
It is delicious, satisfying but not stuffing, not sugary and just just great.  
And the waiters and waitresses are really more like humble servants.  They are solicitous and very very knowledgeable of the menu.  Try it, you will not regret it.

data.title: Tasty Vegetarian Restaurant
data.text:
Full Disclosure: I'm not Vegetarian and I prefer having a glass or wine with dinner. So why have I eaten at this restaurant on my last two visits to Wichita and even went twice on the last trip? The food. I understand the Chef is from the Caribbean and he uses interesting blends of spices on the menu choices. For the Valentine's Day special dinner he had an appetizer that was half an avocado with roasted mushrooms and spices that was one of the best starters I've ever eaten. My entree was a faux salmon and I could have ordered a second helping as it was delicious.

The restaurant does not serve alcoholic beverages. There's no BYOB sign so not sure they would even let you bring in wine for dinner. The Chef does prepare interesting fruit and spice smoothies which are good but served in small glasses. However, the food is so good I forget I'm at a vegetarian restaurant and can forego wine with my dinner. There is not a lot of ambiance and for the dark winter nights  they need more light so one can read the menu and see their food. The service is friendly and informative but be prepared to wait as most menu items are cooked to order. Even if you're not a vegetarian I'd recommend taking time to visit this Wichita gem. Limited hours so call ahead.

data.title: Interesting place
data.text:
My coworkers and I were looking for a quick bite to eat, for Italian. Somehow this pulled up on our map and decided to check it out two blocks away.... The set up is very charming, but the restaurant is small. I cant put a finger on what type if restaurant it specializes in.... My coworker had the buffet of couscous and curry items I cant remember, he said it great and id go back to try that. I had the spaghetti marinara which didn't appease me at all. It had a bit of tasty pesto sauce on top, but the marinara was watery and seemed of a canned like base with a few pinch of fresh herbs thrown on top, and reminded me of just good cafeteria food. 

Wont rush back, but if I do get dragged back here id go with the spicy couscous dishes.

data.title: Hard to find but great food
data.text: Why is this hidden?  Only a sandwich board sign!  We were in city for a conference.  Someone recommended this for lunch.  Party of 5.  Great food - choices were very creative and healthy. Excellent service.  Unusual setting in a courtyard in what we thought was an office building.  But no sign other than a sandwich board on the sidewalk and no adjacent parking.  Wichita is strange in that regard. Sure recommend this.  Appears to be associated with the Seven-Day Adventist church.

data.title: Delicious food and excellent service!
data.text: My first trip to the Garden Grill was courtesy of a groupon :) I'd never been there before. A bit difficult to find but we went after dark so it's to be expected. It was well worth it. I had the Haystacks. Similar to nachos. Such a large portion I couldn't eat it all there. Average price for an entree was around $9.00. Fantastic deal when you consider the portion size, the flavors of everything coming together in that dish, the excellent service and sweetest hostess you'll ever meet along with the ambiance. Breathtaking, in my opinion, when you look up.  Love love loved it and I'll definitely be going back even without a groupon in the future!

data.title: Good lunch place
data.text: The Garden Grill Cafe is located in a nice building and the menu is a bit special compared to what I am used to. The sandwich and soups are good, the service is average but it is a great place for a lunch with friends or business relations. Parking might be a problem, but that is normal (at least for me) in this part of Wichita during a working day. I would come back here for a healthy lunch.

data.title: Horrible customer service- didn't even eat.
data.text:
We arrived on a Thursday evening, excited for dinner at one of the only vegetarian places in Wichita. First off, it was difficult to find. It is in a building that houses multiple businesses, and was poorly marked- I wasn't sure where our GPS was leading us, because it did not look like a place a restaurant would be. 

Either way, we found it, and followed signs to the back of the restaurant (because the front door of the building was locked). We opened the door, and it felt like the entire restaurant turned and stared. We made our way through the restaurant to the back, where there looked to be a hostess stand and waited to be acknowledged. This took several minutes, as the place looked chaotic. Finally, a waiter came over and told us that we might want to come back another time because the wait would be so long. Okay then. Don't have to tell us twice. Another couple who came in after us also left. 

Although we didn't eat, we did have plenty of time to look at the menu (and peruse the extensive Christian literature pamphlets at every booth). While I am usually excited to try a new vegetarian/vegan restaurant, this one did not look interesting or inventive in the least.

I hope Wichita gets a better vegetarian option soon.

data.title: Love!  Love!  Love!
data.text: This vegan cafe is amazing. I love being able to order anything I want. The calzone was delicious!  The haystacks are huge and delicious!  Can't go wrong with the pizza, better than anything non-vegan!    The artichoke salad and dressing is amazing!  Top it off with the best brownie sundae ever and it's the perfect meal.

data.title: Awesome
data.text: Excellent vegan food. The pizza and salad were delicious!  I could eat there every day. My husband is not vegan and loved the spaghetti. Parking is bad, but park on 2nd in the meters and they'll pay for it. I wish I could eat here everyday!!

data.title: Great tasting healthy food!
data.text: This is one of the best vegan restaurants anywhere in the country. The only downside is parking. However, your best bet is park on 2nd street and the restaurant will reimburse you. This is my favorite choice for lunch. Go now!

data.title: Unique Flavors
data.text: I must confess that this was my first experience with vegan cuisine, and I was pleasantly surprised.  The chef here creates some amazing flavors that must be tasted to be believed!  I was very impressed by his skill.  That was diminished somewhat by their problems with ingredient availability.  On two dishes which I ordered, I was informed that that had neither portobello mushrooms nor kalamata olives.  (I'm guessing that any vegan restaurant should be well-stocked with those.)  The atmosphere was unique and enjoyable, though I wouldn't describe it as "romantic".   The service was somewhat tentative, but not bad.  The chef stopped by our table, and we enjoyed visiting with him.  I'll definitely be back sometime!

data.title: So Many Vegan Choices!
data.text: Finding a restaurant where, as a vegan, I can order ANYTHING from the menu is always fun. The Garden Grill was that and so much more. The variety of menu choices ranged from simple burgers to gourmet foods. My travel partner ordered a burger which came with fun, delicious potato wedges. I opted for the daily special and was dazzled by what I received. We enjoyed the experience so much we planned the return part of our trip so we could stop at this restaurant again. The ambiance was delightful as this restaurant is nestled in a historic hotel building (now converted offices). The design was creative, colorful, and reminded me of being in New Orleans. Discovered the space used to be the stables way back in the early history... and yet created a very delightful dining experience. And if you get the chance to enjoy a Sunday buffet at the Garden Grill... take it! Fabulous, plentiful food that delighted the palate. My new "favorite" restaurant in Kansas for sure. The only negative with this restaurant is they don't have their own parking directly next to their location. Rather you need to park either on the street or in the parking lot behind the restaurant (across the alley). But finding parking is so worth the food. Stop by. Enjoy amazing gourmet vegan food in a fun atmosphere.

data.title: A gem of a cafe located in Wichita, KS.
data.text: First off, the Garden Grill Cafe is located in a very unique building in Wichita, the Occidental Plaza, which was built in 1873-1874.  This gives the building great character and the Garden Grill Cafe receives some of that same great character.  Once you step inside you notice the open floor plan.  The cafe is set inside a foyer.  Chef Miguel Larcher,  who has studied and trainied in France, has created a outstanding menu for vegan food in Wichita.  Before you stop reading this because I used the word vegan, take a look at the attached menu.  How can you not like a sandwich made with Grilled portabella, lettuce, tomato, with scallion dressing and fresh basil oil on Focaccia bread?  How about a pizza made with Fresh spinach, roma tomato, red onion, kalamata olive, fresh basil, and house veg cheese?  The food Chef Larcher and his staff create has to be the best food I have tested in many year vegan or not.  Try the sunday brunch.  You can find Chef Larcher's facebook page and see what are the specials and menu's for Sunday brunch. Take some time out of your busy day and try the Garden Grill Cafe.

data.title: Excellent !!
data.text: Situé dans un ancien bâtiment réaménagé , ce restaurant et son patron valent vraiment le détour . Ici c'est la créativité au service du goût ! Vraiment surprenant et très bon , le tout dans une ambiance conviviale ... A recommander !
